intro: Borreria suaveolens f. rigidior, commonly known as the rigid shrub borreria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its upright, woody stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in cymes. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Mexico and is adapted to thrive in hot, dry conditions. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
